result.execSummary:
The defendant Sirmont T Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$4,380.63 TO Tim H. for lost wages; and $14,049.10 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
*3/21/2016  Honorable Jeffrey Wagner-Order signed:  Zero restitution to Mr. H.; and total amount of $14,049.01 to Crime Victim Compensation.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not carrry or possess any firearms/body armor; and  voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Defendant's application for return of seized property (unspecified).
Decision and Order DENYING Motion for Postconviction Relief  signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for postconviction relief under sec. 974.06, Stats.
Original Transcript (25 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING, commencing FEBRUARY 16, 2016, received and filed.
Amended per Order signed on 3/21/2016.

Order signed and filed as to restitution.
THE COURT HEREBY ORDERS that the restitution amount owed to Mr. Hurt is $0 and the total amount of restitution be set at $14,049.01 owed to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
Filed: Signed Notice of  Stipulation.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On 12-28-2015 Branch 25 vacated the plea that had been previously entered and reinstated count 2.  The PSI was filed in court file and the court reviewed it prior to proceeding today.  The court inquires if the defendant would like to meet with PSI writer to which he declines.
Plea hearing proceeded.  As to count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statement by Michael P.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 72 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 326 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 36 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Pay stipulated restitution in the amount of $4380.63 to Tim. H for lost wages and $14,049.10 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed: Pretrial Credit; CR-234; CR-233; CR-218
ADA Schoepp and Atty Klimetz are requesting a plea/sentencing date on 2-16-2016 at 8:15.  Defendant at CJF and to be produced.
Discussion regarding bail. Defendant was previously remanded at the plea hearing. Court set cash bail at $100,000.00.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Restitution packet received and filed. Statements made as to sentencing. Additional statements made by John H., Timothy H. Discussion regarding restitution. 

During the sentencing defendant requested to withdraw his plea. Court granted the defendant's request and VACATED the plea on COUNT 1 and REINSTATED COUNT 2. 

Defense counsel requested to withdraw as counsel. Court denied defense request at this time. 
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Branch 25 is in trial. Due to the lateness of the hour and Branch 25 being in trial, Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Restitution information packet received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

As to COUNT 2-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution. Court advised the parties of the possibility the court will not follow the recommendation. Court took a break to allow defense counsel time to talk to the defendant. Court back on the record. Appearances remain the same. Defendant wishes to proceed with the plea today. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court vacated the jury trial date of 10/19/15.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution information received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are still in negotiations and request an adjourned final pretrial date. State turned over a new offer to the defense today and will place the new offer on the record at the next date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/19/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Proposed Verdict Forms  received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List  received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine  received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  10/21/15.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court advised that if there are any motions that are to be filed, movant must file by 8/12/15; response due by 9/01/15; reply due by 9/08/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions, witness lists and substantive jury instructions must be filed one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  SPEEDY Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the Court that he is obtaining better quality video; State also indicated that it is having their IT Department look into getting a better quality video.  Based upon the statements made, defense counsel requested an adjournment of the trial date and stated that his client will waive his right to a speedy trial.  Court had colloquy with defendant regarding same.  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to speedy trial at this time.  Case continued before Branch 20.  Hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
/to 6/19/15 at 11:00 a.m. - motion hearing.  Bailiffs notified to produce defendant.
/to the court from defendant, filed.
/from defendant to the Court, filed.
/to the court from defendant, received and filed.
/for Substitution of Counsel, signed and filed.  Attorney Klimetz is now the attorney of record.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing APRIL 13, 2015 received and filed. (13 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTY GARY ROSENTHAL 207 E BUFFALO AVE SUITE 509 MILWAUKEE WI 53202.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  7/20/15.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Sirmont T Davis not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.    Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set the following motion schedule: movant has until 5/11/15 to file; response due by 6/01/15; reply due by 6/08/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date; any alibi notices must be filed per statute.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Tony Castro-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Branch 20, Judge Moroney due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Steve O's Bar and Grill, T.H., and J.H.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sirmont T Davis in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Sirmont T Davis in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
